title: Ticket #1287: optimize handling of shadow failure (reduce fsyncs)
description:
When a shadow exits with an exception code, the schedd performs a number of updates to the job ad that are each committed as a separate durable transaction (one fsync per transaction). The result is that a fairly low rate of shadow failures can cause the schedd to become unresponsive, which causes more shadow failures. This can lead to an endless cycle of shadow failure.

Eight transactions happen in _mark_job_stopped(). Additionally, there is a transaction in jobExitCode() to increment the shadow exception count. None of these transactions need to be durable.
remarks:
2010-Mar-17 11:19:25 by danb:
Note that even job eviction causes mark_job_stopped() to be called, so one way to get into the cycle of failure was to start with a bunch of jobs being evicted. Then the schedd became unresponsive and the shadow failure cycle ensued.
